name: split-join
description: A VS Code extension for splitting and joining text, inspired by mini.splitjoin.

splitJoin.detect.brackets.description: Bracket pairs in which split/join should operate. Each entry should be a two-character string, e.g. '()', '[]', '{}'.
splitJoin.detect.brackets.markdownDescription: Bracket pairs in which split/join should operate. Each entry should be a two-character string, e.g. '()', '[]', '{}'.
splitJoin.detect.brackets.title: Detect: Brackets

splitJoin.detect.separator.description: JavaScript RegExp source used to detect argument separators (matched at top level only).
splitJoin.detect.separator.markdownDescription: JavaScript RegExp source used to detect argument separators (matched at top level only). Example: `[,;]`.
splitJoin.detect.separator.title: Detect: Separator

splitJoin.detect.excludeRegions.description: Region kinds in which separators are ignored during detection. Supported values: (), [], {}, "", and ''.
splitJoin.detect.excludeRegions.markdownDescription: Region kinds in which separators are ignored during detection. Supported values: `()`, `[]`, `{}`, `""`, `''`.
splitJoin.detect.excludeRegions.title: Detect: Exclude Regions

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
